spanishExample: ¡Espera dentro del hospital!
englishTranslation: Wait inside the hospital!
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun
dentro: inside (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: ¡Espera! Vayamos adelante del hospital.
englishTranslation: Wait! Let’s go in front of the hospital.
vocabIncluded: adelante: in front (adverb often used with de)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
no vayamos: "let's not go" (Ir, imperative, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¡Espere! La cosa está ahí abajo.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Wait! The thing is under there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener

spanishExample: ¡Espere! No tiene que ir de aquí para allá.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Wait! You don’t have to go all around.
vocabIncluded: de aquí para allá: from here to there (idiom)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¡Esperen! Eso está demasiado lejos.
englishTranslation: (Plural) Wait! That is too far.

spanishExample: ¡Esperen! Tienen que ver el mundo desde arriba.
englishTranslation: (Plural) Wait! You have to see the world from above.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
arriba: up/upwards (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: Ella esperaba que fueras para allá.
englishTranslation: She was hoping you were going over there(vague).
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
esperaba: hoped/waited/expected, I hoped/waited/expected (Esperar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Espera cerca de la escuela, pero viene para acá.
englishTranslation: She waits near the school, but she’s coming over here.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
espera: hope/wait/expect, he/she/it hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 3rd person)
para acá: over here/in this direction (idiom)

spanishExample: Espera que sean los mejores del equipo.
englishTranslation: She hopes they are the best on the team.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
espera: hope/wait/expect, he/she/it hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Esperaba que no fueras afuera.
englishTranslation: I was hoping for you not to go outside.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
esperaba: hoped/waited/expected, I hoped/waited/expected (Esperar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Esperaba que pudiéramos ver la tierra desde acá.
englishTranslation: I was hoping we could see the Earth from here.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
esperaba: hoped/waited/expected, I hoped/waited/expected (Esperar, imperfect, 1st person)
pudiéramos: "were able", "we were able" (Poder, subjunctive past, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Esperamos que no vayas hacia atrás.
englishTranslation: We hope you don’t go backwards.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
esperamos:  hope/wait/expect, we  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Esperamos que pueda ir atrás de ese lugar.
englishTranslation: We hope she can go behind that place.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
atrás: back/backwards (adverb often used with de)
esperamos:  hope/wait/expect, we  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 1st person plural)
pueda: "be able", "I be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Esperan poder tener un cuarto en el hotel.
englishTranslation: They hope to be able to have a room in the hotel.
vocabIncluded: esperan:  hope/wait/expect, they  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Esperan que estés aquí con ellos.
englishTranslation: They hope you are here with them.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
esperan:  hope/wait/expect, they  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Esperas que yo vaya a tu pueblo.
englishTranslation: You expect me to go to your town.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
esperas:  hope/wait/expect, you  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Espero en la calle de atrás.
englishTranslation: I wait in the back street.
vocabIncluded: espero:  hope/wait/expect, I  hope/wait/expect  (Esperar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Espero que puedas ver mi ciudad algún día.
englishTranslation: I hope you can see my city some day.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
espero:  hope/wait/expect, I  hope/wait/expect  (Esperar, present, 1st person)
puedas: "be able", "you be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Está esperando en su cuarto.
englishTranslation: She is waiting in her room.

spanishExample: Lo estamos esperando, pero no tiene nada que ver contigo.
englishTranslation: We’re waiting for him, but it doesn’t have anything to do with you.
vocabIncluded: tener que ver: have to do (with) (idiom)

spanishExample: Nunca me esperas.
englishTranslation: You never wait for me.
vocabIncluded: esperas:  hope/wait/expect, you  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Puedes esperar en cualquier lado.
englishTranslation: You can wait anywhere.

spanishExample: Tienes que esperar allí.
englishTranslation: You have to wait there(3rd place).
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Todo el mundo esperaba allá, en el pueblo.
englishTranslation: Everybody was waiting yonder, in the town.
vocabIncluded: esperaba: hoped/waited/expected, he/she/it hoped/waited/expected (Esperar, imperfect, 3rd person)
